author: A_Brickset_user
title: Cool Mini Set
review:
I also got this in my stocking for Christmas. These are so cool!
The design of the Slave 1 is ingenius, it looks exactly like the Movie ship. The wings never fall off for me, because I hold it on the very bottom.
The Jedi Starfighter is awesome! It is really aerodynamic for a LEGO set, especially one using only exsisting bricks.
I love this set for the pieces, the price, and the design.(definitely!)

author: A_Brickset_user
title: ''Blast This is why I hate flying!''
review: cool cool cool this is defenatly one of best MINI sets out there. and like evryone else said it is one os the best dog fights in Star Wars. i really like the detail on Slave 1 and the Jedi Starfighter, incredible!!!! the only resone i gave it 9/10 is because i dont like giving MINIs perfects because I like the bigger versons more.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: another great mini set!
review:
after the mini at-st + snowspeeder and the mini x-wing + tie advanced, this is my favourite starwars mini set.

the jedi starfighter is just flawless, with it's sleek design that just screams high speed and maneuverability. it features two printed parts, which add to the details on this fighter, but the model doesn't rely on these two pieces to look good. just replace the two pieces with unprinted pieces. the model will still look good.

the slave 1 is great as well, the wings can be put in it's flying position, as shown on the picture above, or in the ground position, in which the slave 1 lays on it's back with the wings turned resting on the ground. the flatiron design of the ship in the movie has been recreated perfectly in this small scale, and again a printed part adds to the detail without being neccesary.

with everything top-notch, why ain't i giving this set a ten? because of one small gripe, the somewhat flimsy wings on the slave 1, besides that, everything is great, so it gets a 9!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Little Good Bar
review:
This is the perfect recreator of the fantastic seen in the movie. I love the slave 1 and the starfighter is always a goodie. it is a good set to pretend with because the ships are small  and easy to hold. This is good. Buy it if you like mini's. I like the big expensive stuff like the real slave 1 and jedi starfighter not mini.
Byb the way, WHO LOVES THE X-WING! IT ROCKS!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Good Solid Set
review: Great sequence in the film, pretty good set.  I really like the solid nature of the Rebel Starfighter, but there's just soemthing lacking in Slave 1 that I can't quite put my finger on.  Still it's a good set, and it has that extra piece for the Tie Bomber.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Release the spare parts, now
review:
This set is wicked. It was my second mini set and it is fun to build and easy to play with and vise-versa. The Jedi starfighter was a brilliant little build if you ask me but the slave 1 just seemed to missing something, but maybe it's just me. As I like the newer minis better I have slightly grown to like the others over this. Maybe thats the reason I think the Slave 1 is missing something. 
Oh well overall a great set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Best 1-1 Dogfight scene ever!!!!
review: This set is dashing! The Slave 1 is the best part, it really looks like the slave 1! They are big enough to hold under control and are small enough to maneuver fast!  The Slave 1 ship being way more powerful but the Jedi Starfighter being faster, who shall win? Go Jango!!!! The Delta-7 Aethersprite Interceptor (Jedi Starfighter) is fast and look much real as a mini! Glad they released this set, so very very glad!

author: tauntaunwampa
title: Mr. Average
review:
This Set is pretty average, yes it is good but its not to scale with the other minis it is very good for play dogfights (But why couldnt we have 5 arms)

PROS
no stickers 
small pieces 
good for dogfights

CONS
wings of slave 1 fall of
not to scale with other minis

i got this set because i wanted the tie bomber but i do use these ships occasionly.

author: Ovid07
title: Last Mini! ! !
review:
If it weren't for the horrible Slave 1, I'd give this a 10/10.

PROS
Amazing Jedi Star fighter Thingy.
No stupid decals.

CONS
Slave 1, despite being to scale, has no detail, wrong colores (or is it colorus?), and looks awful.  Being that Slave 1 is my favorite star wars vehicle of all time (pods come second), I will NOT stand for this!
That is such a big con it will count twice!

OVERALL
I guess after reviewing all the minis, I have to end on a sad note.

author: hedgehog_lover
title: Cheesy set
review:
This mini rests in pieces inside my big box of Lego along with my other minis.Once again i shall do a pros and cons review.

Pros:
acurate
can have mini battles

Cons;
Slave 1's side wings fall off
both fragile
Limited playability
Slave 1 cannons are  fragile

Buy if you want to build the mini tie bomber or need parts.
Don't buy if you don't want to waste money that could be used to buy a good set.

author: hustla187
title: Classic Dogfight
review: If you want a SW mini set that you can play with, this is the one. You get a mini Jedi Starfighter and a mini Slave 1 which are both from Episode 2. I really like the detail of both ships even though they are in mini scale. Lego did a great job on this mini set.

author: Leggodt94
title: Good interpretation
review: I really like this mini set, and it's by far one of my favorites. It depicts a good scene with great detail, especially the jedi starfighter. Plus, the wings and guns adjust for the slave I. Also includes second pod from the tie bomber.

author: starwarsgeek101_
title: Just what you need
review:
If you do not have enough space for the bigger version of the
slave I and the Jedi star fighter than this set is perfect for you! You are able to make great displays of amazing star wars battles with these mini-sets! It also includes parts for the mini tie bomber!
So, overall this set is reasonably priced and is handy for your collection.

author: Yoda____
title: one of my favourite mini's
review:
This set is, well, just read the title and find out. Unfortunately all of the other of the mini's in this series one of them is great but the other is just average. In this one Obi's fighter is the better of the two. It's small but sleek and has printed bricks. The slave 1 lets this set down. It's a bit to clunky, the wings don't look right aand there aren't any redeeming features.
5 for the Starfighter
3 for the Slave 1

author: Pepper
title: nice MINI
review:
This set is rather nice, for a MINI. It has good pieces, and 3, I repeat, 3 printed pieces!

pros:
-Slave 1 looks good
-printed pieces
-pieces in general
-MINI TIE Bomber parts

cons:
-Jedi Starfighter looks kinda weird

Overall, this set is fine. If you display LEGOs, then this is the set for you!

author: Kalhiki
title: good detail
review:
For a mini, this is great. Obi Wan's starfighter is a little basic, but it's a mini model, what are you going to do? The designs on the top front add detail and make up for the basic design. The Slave I is a little better. It's definately larger than the Jedi Starfighter, but is equally detailed. 
There isn't much else. What you see in the picture is pretty much what you get. So Overall a good set. The lack of originality is the downfall in the set, but It's better than most minis.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Jedi Starfighter & Slave I Review
review:
This is also one of the very first LEGO Star Wars sets ever. It's a great set and it's part of the movie 'Star Wars - Episode II' where Jango Fett chased Obi-Wan Kenobi. This set is also a set which has some rare pieces. There're no stickers in this set which means that these pieces are valuable. The space ships may don't have any play features but this set is a great set to get for pieces which you can use for brickfilms and/or MOC's. But I think you should try to get the bigger ones first before you get this one.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Review

author: United_Bricks
title: Very good lego star wars set.
review:
This is a set what I got on ebay, I'm am a lego star wars collector so I think this set is awsome. This set is a small set so it doesn't have any minifigs. The ships are Slave 1 and

obi-wan's starfighter.


Starfighter 

The starfighter is small but detailed. First of all their is two printed pieces on the ship, they make it look better. The ship has white, dark red and some grey on it. This set captures the mini scale on this ship. OVERALL 5/5


SLAVE 1

The slave 1 is my favorite in the set, again it has only one printed piece on this model. It has a selection of color's on the ship.  OVERALL 5/5

EXTRA

If you get 4484, 4485 and 4486 and this set you can build a mini Tie-bomber to go with your collection of minis. In each set you get a couple of pieces to build the tie bomber. I think this a great feature which makes this set even better. OVERALL 5/5


  OVERALL

I think this set would be nice for any star wars collector and I will give this set a

15/15.
(please read my other reviews on other lego sets Legoboy12345678)

author: Hylocera
title: Cool Mini
review: This was a mini I got for Christmas a while ago, and I remember struggling over the pieces ( I was like 4 then) impatiently trying to finish the set. It was a great thing to be able to stick a LEGO Set in your pocket for a car trip and not have to worry about lost pieces. The best thing was that because they were so small, you could easily play with them, instead of juggling the larger Slave I and Obi Wan's Jedi Starfighter in each hand. The simple build allowed even the most impatient of kids to finish it quickly for play. The only problem with this set was that it could have come with a couple astroids, just like the podracers could've come with a finish line or some pinnacles. 4/5

author: AETerry
title: #4487 Mini Set Review
review:
As with all of the Star Wars Mini Sets, the big draw for me has been their price with second how on a minature scale, the detail of various different Star Wars Vehicles has been captured without having to try and guess which ship is which.

 

For me, I like the Slave I Ship given that it's Boba Fett's ship. The other doesn't bother me too much. Either way, both are great and have been fun to build and place around for display.

author: zako11
title: Destoy Obi-wans Starfighter
review: This set is a good build for little kids and gives them some experience they might need .It is good to play with and is not too big or heavy like its bigger versions. it might be good for stopmotions too because you could use them for the space battle (they would be easier to move) and if you need to do close ups you can use the bigger versions.

author: Odeinoichus
title: I Hate Flying
review:
Set #4487 Jedi Starfighter & Slave 1: This is the last of the first group of four Minis and it is fitting that we get a scene from Attack of the Clones out of it. It is also a nice little set that offers up some rare Mini-Kit vehicles.

 

The Jedi Starfighter truly captures the vehicle in Mini scale. And the colors on it are actually quite nice. The Slave 1 is Jango's pride and joy and a very interesting looking vessel in Mini scale. With some nice unique pieces and a few rich color choices both vessels are really great looking and fun little ships using the same basic principles of the other three.

 

And now to discuss the TIE Bomber Mini as promised. 4484-4487 all included extra pieces to build up a Mini-Kit of the TIE Bomber. The TIE Bomber is a wonderful additional bonus to have, it resembles the vehicle in question quite nicely and uses some great pieces. It was the selling point of the Minis for the first two years, buy all four and you get an additional fifth vehicle, or ninth in the case of the first batch since you got two models with each set. A pity the Minis stopped being such a regular fixture of the line to include that sort of deal in future offerings, but it wasn't all bad.

 

Overall I'd have to say this set is worthy of becoming a part of your collection. All of the Minis are definitely great value for your money and the playability of these sets is beyond measure. The only reason I've scored them as four rather than five is simply because I feel that they aren't exactly five brick material, simply because they are simple and easy to build and use up fairly limited parts. But I could change my mind in the future and shift them up a notch, simply because of the fun factor alone. If you don't already own any of these wonderful sets try your best to get them, they are worthy of joining any LEGO Star Wars enthusiasts collection.
